cause.description: This is a cause designed to cure America (and beyond) of its apparant apathy and indifference to its homeless. Advocates of this cause will work toward a day when every man, woman, and child have decent living arrangements. ---------------------------------------- Here are some websites to volunteer organizations that you can join to help solve the problem of homelessness: 1. Porchlightinc => Porchlight provides emergency shelter, food, employment services, counseling, and affordable transitional and permanent housing. 2. Alpha Project => Alpha Project for the Homeless is a nonprofit human services organization that serves over 4,000 men, women, and children each day. Services offered include affordable housing, residential substance abuse treatment, outreach and prevention, etc. 3. Homes For The Homeless => Homes for the Homeless (HFH) is the nation's largest provider of residential, education and employment training centers—serving over 630 homeless families and over 1,200 homeless children each day at five separate sites across New York City. 4. Building Opportunites for Self-Sufficiency => BOSS is dedicated to helping poor, homeless, and disabled people achieve health and self-sufficiency, and to fighting against the root causes of poverty and homelessness. Scroll down to the bottom and click on the table of contents for more information. 5. National Student Campaign Against Hunger and Homelessness => The Campaign is committed to ending hunger and homelessness in America by educating, engaging, and training students to directly meet individuals’ immediate needs while advocating for long-term systemic solutions. 6. The Fuller Center for Housing => The Fuller Center for Housing builds homes in partnership with homeowner families who put in hundreds of hours of sweat equity and pay it all forward at no-profit and no-interest. It also uses The Greater Blessing Program for home rehab projects, typically for the elderly. It's at work throughout the U.S. and in a number of nations overseas. If you have any questions or comments about volunteer opportunites in your area, please feel free to send me a message. 1. Having a home is a necessity. 2. Every person in America and the world beyond should have a home. 3. Having a home and an address makes it easier to get a job. 4. Jobs provide money for food, education, and other necessities.
cause.mission: To bring about a day in which there is not a single person in United States, and eventually the world, who is without a home.
cause.name: Homes for the Homeless
